title: The Bandit King's Toll
description: A group of self-styled 'Ridge-Lords' has blockaded the main trade road to the High Ward.

turns.narrative: The blockade is a wall of spikes and overturned wagons. In the center sits a man on a throne of rusted shields—the Bandit King, 'Iron-Jaw' Jax.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You convince him that a tax-paying road is better than a blockaded one. (+1 Stability)
turns.choice_b: Scout their flank for a weak point (Perception DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find their stores of oil are dangerously close to their barracks. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.convergence: Jax is not a common thug; he wears the armor of a fallen City Warden.

turns.narrative: Jax demands 10% of the settlement's monthly income or 'the head of the current High Warden'.
turns.choice_a: Refuse and challenge him to a duel
turns.consequence_a: Success: The bandits respect the old laws. A circle is formed. (+100 XP)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The road is cleared temporarily. (-100 Gold)
turns.convergence: Jax steps down from his throne, his giant 'Sunder-Mace' sparking against the stone.

turns.narrative: The duel is to first blood or yield. The bandits chant Jax’s name, their weapons beating a rhythm on their shields.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You weather the giant mace's impact, your shield arm numbing but holding. (+1 Progress)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a gap in his Warden-plate. Jax grunts in surprise. (+100 XP)
turns.convergence: Jax laughs. 'You've got spirit, pup. But I've got the Ridge on my side!'

turns.narrative: Jax uses a smoke-bomb, the thick gray cloud filling the dueling circle. He moves with surprising silence for a man of his size.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You hear the air-displacement and duck. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.choice_b: Sweeping strike to clear the air
turns.consequence_b: Failure: You strike only smoke, leaving your back exposed. (-5 HP)
turns.convergence: Jax emerges from the fog behind you, his mace high.

turns.narrative: Jax’s mace misses your head by an inch, shattering a nearby wagon-wheel. He is breathing heavy now.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You twist the mace from his grip.jax falls to his knees. (+100 XP)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You end the threat. The bandits disperse in fear. (+1 Rep)
turns.convergence: The Bandit King yields. He offers you his 'Ridge-Lord' ring as a sign of respect.

turns.narrative: With the King defeated, the Trade Road is open. Caravans begin to move again, their drivers giving you a wide berth.
turns.choice_a: Offer Jax a job in the City Guard
turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a powerful, if untrustworthy, lieutenant. (+5 Defense, -2 Morale)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He leaves, but his legend will grow in the wastes. (+3 Rep)
turns.convergence: You find a hidden stash of trade goods in the King’s throne.

turns.narrative: The stash contains 'Oakhaven Spices'—luxury items that have been missing for months.
turns.choice_a: Return the spices to the Merchant Guild
turns.consequence_a: Success: They reward you with a share of the profits. (+150 Gold)
turns.choice_b: Distribute the spices to the refugees
turns.consequence_b: Success: A rare taste of luxury boosts camp hope significantly. (+5 Morale)
turns.convergence: A Trade Envoy from the High Ward arrives, looking for Jax.

turns.narrative: The Envoy is clearly working with Jax. He realization that Jax is gone makes him reach for a hidden knife.
turns.choice_a: Subdue the traitor (Sleight of Hand DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You capture the man before he can react. (+1 Intel)
turns.choice_b: Bribe the Envoy for information (50 Gold)
turns.consequence_b: Success: He reveals the Trade Guild was 'paying' Jax to block certain rivals. (+1 Lore)
turns.convergence: The conspiracy is deeper than simple banditry.

turns.narrative: Back at the settlement, the Council asks for your final recommendation on a 'Permanent Road Guard'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: A dedicated force for the trade roads. (+2 Stability, -1 Resource/turn)
turns.choice_b: Hire the remaining Bandits as mercenaries
turns.consequence_b: Success: Cheap security, but high risk of corruption. (+1 Security)
turns.convergence: The Trade Road is now the 'Warden’s Way'.

turns.consequence_a: Success: You gain a weapon capable of shattering stone walls. (+1 Heavy Weapon)
turns.choice_b: Display it in the City Hall
turns.consequence_b: Success: A trophy of your triumph for all to see. (+5 Reputation)

conclusion: The Ridge-Lords are broken. Jax is either an ally or a memory, and the trade road is once again the lifeblood of Warden-Keep.

risk_matrix.penalty: Road remains blocked. -10 Settlement Income and -2 Morale.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.

location: The Ridgeback Trade Road — Iron-Jaw Pass
